page.title: 14Education
page.content: All the children living within the survey area attend either primary schools in{Normanton}or{Sutton,}or secondary education in the larger towns. Some children are able to walk to school if they live in these villages, others travel by bicycle, by private car or by school buses. Normanton has 3 buildings which are or have been the village school. The first was built in the early 19th. century for 10 poor children from the village. It is now a private house. Then came a larger building behind the original, to educate 90 children. This building is now the village hall. The new primary school is just outside the survey area, and the average school roll is 35, with 2 full-time staff. The old{Weston}village school and schoolhouse are now the village hall. Weston does not have a village school.
